standard_metadata.standard_description: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $x$ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.5(5-7x) &=  8- (4x + 6) \\\\ 2.5 -3.5x &= 8 - 4x - 6 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 2.5-3.5x &= 2-4x ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2.5-3.5x \blueD{+4x} &= 2-4x \blueD{+4x} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 4x to each side}}\\\\ 2.5 +0.5x &= 2 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2.5 + 0.5x  \blueD{-2.5}&= 2\blueD{-2.5}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2.5 from each side}} \\\\ 0.5x&= -0.5~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}} \\\\ \dfrac{0.5x}{\blueD{0.5}}&= \dfrac{-0.5}{\blueD{0.5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 0.5}} \\\\ x &= \greenD{-1} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}} \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$x = \greenD{-1}~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  a  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 3+0.5(4a+8) &=  9-2a \\\\ 3+2a+4 &= 9-2a~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 2a+7 &= 9-2a~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2a+7\blueD{+2a} &= 9-2a\blueD{+2a} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 2a to each side}}\\\\ 4a+7 &= 9~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 4a+7\blueD{-7} &=9 \blueD{-7} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 7 from each side}}\\\\ 4a &=2 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{4a}{\blueD{4}}&= \dfrac{2}{\blueD{4}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4}} \\\\ a &= \greenD{0.5} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  a= \greenD{   0.5  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  b  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.75(8b+4)-1 &=  4b+14 \\\\ 6b+3-1 &= 4b+14~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 6b+2 &= 4b+14~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 6b+2\blueD{-4b} &= 4b+14\blueD{-4b} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 4b from each side}}\\\\ 2b+2 &=14 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2b+2\blueD{-2} &=14 \blueD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side}}\\\\ 2b &=12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2b}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{12}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ b &= \greenD{6} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  b= \greenD{  6   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ c   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.2(10-5c) &=  5c-16 \\\\ 2-c &= 5c-16~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 2-c\blueD{-5c} &= 5c-16\blueD{-5c} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 5c from each side}}\\\\ 2-6c &= -16~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2-6c\blueD{-2} &= -16\blueD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side}}\\\\  -6c&=-18 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-6c}{\blueD{-6}}&= \dfrac{-18}{\blueD{-6}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -6}} \\\\ c &= \greenD{3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ c = \greenD{   3  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  d  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.5(7d+4) &=  7-1.5d \\\\ 3.5d+2 &= 7-1.5d~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 3.5d+2\blueD{+1.5d} &= 7-1.5d\blueD{+1.5d} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 1.5d to each side}}\\\\  5d+2&=7 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 5d+2\blueD{-2} &= 7\blueD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side}}\\\\  5d&=5 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{5d}{\blueD{5}}&= \dfrac{5}{\blueD{5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 5}} \\\\ d &= \greenD{1} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$d  = \greenD{   1  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ e   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.75(8+e) &=  2-1.25e \\\\ 6+0.75e &= 2-1.25e~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 6+0.75e\blueD{+1.25e} &= 2-1.25e\blueD{+1.25e} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 1.25e to each side}}\\\\  6+2e&=2 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 6+2e\blueD{-6} &= 2\blueD{-6} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 6 from each side}}\\\\ 2e &= -4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2e}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{-4}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ e &= \greenD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  e= \greenD{ -2    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  f  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4(0.5f-0.25) &=  6+f \\\\ 2f-1 &= 6+f~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 2f-1\blueD{-f} &= 6+f\blueD{-f} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract f from each side}}\\\\ f-1 &=6 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ f-1\blueD{+1} &=6 \blueD{+1} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 1 to each side}}\\\\ f &= \greenD{7} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  f= \greenD{7     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  g  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 10(0.4+0.5g) &=  4g \\\\ 4+5g &= 4g~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 4+5g\blueD{-5g} &= 4g\blueD{-5g} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 5g from each side}}\\\\  4&=-g ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ g &= \greenD{-4} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ g = \greenD{   -4  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ h   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 1.5(2-4h)&=6h \\\\ 3-6h &= 6h~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 3-6h\blueD{+6h} &= 6h\blueD{+6h} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 6h to each side}}\\\\ 3 &= 12h~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{3}{\blueD{12}}&= \dfrac{12h}{\blueD{12}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 12}} \\\\ h &= \greenD{\dfrac14} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  h= \greenD{ \dfrac14   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $    k$ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2.5(4k+2) &=  12k \\\\ 10k+5 &= 12k~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 10k+5\blueD{-10k} &= 12k\blueD{-10k} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 10k from each side}}\\\\  5&=2k ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{5}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{2k}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ k &= \greenD{2.5} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  k= \greenD{   2.5  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   m $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4(1+0.5m)&=7m \\\\ 4+2m &= 7m~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 4+2m\blueD{-2m} &= 7m\blueD{-2m} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2m from each side}}\\\\ 4 &=5m ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{4}{\blueD{5}}&= \dfrac{5m}{\blueD{5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 5}} \\\\ m &= \greenD{0.8} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ m = \greenD{ 0.8    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  n  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4n+2 &=  6\left(\dfrac13n-\dfrac23\right) \\\\ 4n+2 &= 2n-4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 4n+2\blueD{-2n} &= 2n-4\blueD{-2n} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2n from each side}}\\\\ 2n+2 &= -4~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 2n+2\blueD{-2} &= -4\blueD{-2} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side}}\\\\ 2n &=-6 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{2n}{\blueD{2}}&= \dfrac{-6}{\blueD{2}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2}} \\\\ n &= \greenD{-3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  n= \greenD{   -3  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   p $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4+2p &=  10\left(\dfrac35p-2\right) \\\\ 4+2p &= 6p-20~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 4+2p\blueD{-6p} &= 6p-20\blueD{-6p} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 6p from each side}}\\\\ 4-4p &=-20 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 4-4p\blueD{-4} &=-20 \blueD{-4} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 4 from each side}}\\\\ -4p &=-24 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{-4p}{\blueD{-4}}&= \dfrac{-24}{\blueD{-4}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -4}} \\\\ p &= \greenD{6} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ p = \greenD{   6  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ r   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac12r-3 &=  3\left(4-\dfrac32r\right) \\\\ \dfrac12r-3 &= 12-\dfrac92r~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ \dfrac12r-3\blueD{+\dfrac92r} &= 12-\dfrac92r\blueD{+\dfrac92r} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add }\dfrac92r \text{ to each side}}\\\\ 5r-3 &=12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 5r-3\blueD{+3} &=12 \blueD{+3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 3 to each side}}\\\\ 5r &=15 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{5r}{\blueD{5}}&= \dfrac{15}{\blueD{5}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 5}} \\\\ r &= \greenD{3} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ r = \greenD{  3   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $    s$ by itself.

$\begin{align} 6s-4 &=  8\left(2+\dfrac14s\right) \\\\ 6s-4 &= 16+2s~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 6s-4\blueD{-2s} &= 16+2s\blueD{-2s} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2s from each side}}\\\\ 4s-4 &= 16~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 4s-4\blueD{+4} &=16 \blueD{+4} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 4 to each side}}\\\\ 4s &=20 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{4s}{\blueD{4}}&= \dfrac{20}{\blueD{4}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4}} \\\\ s &= \greenD{5} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ s = \greenD{  5   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $t    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 3t-18 &=  4\left(-3-\dfrac34t\right) \\\\ 3t-18 &= -12-3t~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 3t-18\blueD{+3t} &= -12-3t\blueD{+3t} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 3t to each side}}\\\\ 6t-18 &=-12 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 6t-18\blueD{+18} &= -12\blueD{+18} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 18 to each side}}\\\\ 6t &= 6~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{6t}{\blueD{6}}&= \dfrac{6}{\blueD{6}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 6}} \\\\ t &= \greenD{1} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$t  = \greenD{   1  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ f   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 9f &=  \dfrac12\left(12f-2\right) \\\\ 9f &= 6f-1~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 9f\blueD{-6f} &= 6f-1\blueD{-6f} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 6f from each side}}\\\\ 3f &=-1 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{3f}{\blueD{3}}&= \dfrac{-1}{\blueD{3}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 3}} \\\\ f &= \greenD{-\dfrac13} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ f = \greenD{    -\dfrac13 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   g $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 12g &=  12\left(\dfrac23g-1\right)+11 \\\\ 12g &= 8g-12+11~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 12g &= 8g-1~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 12g\blueD{-8g} &= 8g-1\blueD{-8g} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Subtract 8g from each side}}\\\\  4g&=-1 ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{4g}{\blueD{4}}&= \dfrac{-1}{\blueD{4}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4}} \\\\ g &= \greenD{-\dfrac14} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  g= \greenD{  -\dfrac14   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  h  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 3h &=  7\left(\dfrac27-\dfrac37h\right)-10 \\\\ 3h &= 2-3h-10~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ 3h &= -8-3h~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ 3h\blueD{+3h} &= -8-3h\blueD{+3h} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add 3h to each side}}\\\\ 6h &= -8~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \dfrac{6h}{\blueD{6}}&= \dfrac{-8}{\blueD{6}}~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 6}} \\\\ h &= \greenD{-\dfrac43} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Simplify}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  h= \greenD{-\dfrac43     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  k  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac14k &=  3\left(-\dfrac14k+3\right) \\\\ \dfrac14k &= -\dfrac34k+9~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Distribute}}\\\\ \dfrac14k\blueD{+\dfrac34k} &= -\dfrac34k+9\blueD{+\dfrac34k} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Add }\dfrac34k\text{ to each side}}\\\\ k &=\greenD{9} ~~~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$  k= \greenD{   9  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
